title: No. 1 hits of the 60's (1960-1965)
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Popular culture
description: Episode of Series "Rock n' roll: the greatest years". This tape provides a nostalgic compilation of classics from the era, smattered with a healthy dose of gossip surrounding the performers. Songs on the tape include: "Stars on 45", Stars on 45: "Only the lonely", Roy Orbison: "Walk right back", Everly Brothers: "The Young ones", Cliff Richard: "Diamonds", Jet Harris: "I Like it", Gerry & the Pacemakers: "Do you love me?", Brian Poole & Tremeloes: "Needles & pins", Searchers: "World without love", Peter & Gordon: "Juliet", Four Pennies: "House of the rising sun", Animals: "Have I the right", Honeycombes: "You really got me", Kinks: "I'm into something good", Hermans Hermits: "Oh pretty woman", Roy Orbison: "Go now", Moody Blues: "You've lost that loving feeling", Righteous Brothers: "I'm alive", The Hollies.
related_objects: Series; S01324; Rock n' roll: the greatest years; Active
